verses.verse: Now Pashur <WH6583> the son <WH1121> of Immer <WH564> the Kohen <WH3548>, who was also chief <WH6496> governor <WH5057> in the house <WH1004> of the YY <WH3068>, heard <WH8085> <WH8799> that Yirmeyah-yahu <WH3414> prophesied <WH5012> <WH8738> these things <WH1697>.

Then Pashur <WH6583> smote <WH5221> <WH8686> Yirmeyah-yahu <WH3414> the prophet <WH5030>, and put <WH5414> <WH8799> him in the stocks <WH4115> that were in the high <WH5945> gate <WH8179> of Binyamin <WH1144>, which was by the house <WH1004> of the YY <WH3068>.

And it came to pass on the morrow <WH4283>, that Pashur <WH6583> brought forth <WH3318> <WH8686> Yirmeyah-yahu <WH3414> out of the stocks <WH4115>. Then said <WH559> <WH8799> Yirmeyah-yahu <WH3414> unto him, The YY <WH3068> hath not called <WH7121> <WH8804> thy name <WH8034> Pashur <WH6583>, but Magormissabib <WH4036>.

For thus saith <WH559> <WH8804> the YY <WH3068>, Behold, I will make <WH5414> <WH8802> thee a terror <WH4032> to thyself, and to all thy friends <WH157> <WH8802>: and they shall fall <WH5307> <WH8804> by the sword <WH2719> of their enemies <WH341> <WH8802>, and thine eyes <WH5869> shall behold <WH7200> <WH8802> it: and I will give <WH5414> <WH8799> all Y'hudah <WH3063> into the hand <WH3027> of the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, and he shall carry them captive <WH1540> <WH8689> into Babylon <WH894>, and shall slay <WH5221> <WH8689> them with the sword <WH2719>.

Moreover I will deliver <WH5414> <WH8804> all the strength <WH2633> of this city <WH5892>, and all the labours <WH3018> thereof, and all the precious things <WH3366> thereof, and all the treasures <WH214> of the kings <WH4428> of Y'hudah <WH3063> will I give <WH5414> <WH8799> into the hand <WH3027> of their enemies <WH341> <WH8802>, which shall spoil <WH962> <WH8804> them, and take <WH3947> <WH8804> them, and carry <WH935> <WH8689> them to Babylon <WH894>.

And thou, Pashur <WH6583>, and all that dwell <WH3427> <WH8802> in thine house <WH1004> shall go <WH3212> <WH8799> into captivity <WH7628>: and thou shalt come <WH935> <WH8799> to Babylon <WH894>, and there thou shalt die <WH4191> <WH8799>, and shalt be buried <WH6912> <WH8735> there, thou, and all thy friends <WH157> <WH8802>, to whom thou hast prophesied <WH5012> <WH8738> lies <WH8267>.

O YY <WH3068>, thou hast deceived <WH6601> <WH8765> me, and I was deceived <WH6601> <WH8735>: thou art stronger <WH2388> <WH8804> than I, and hast prevailed <WH3201> <WH8799>: I am in derision <WH7814> daily <WH3117>, every one mocketh <WH3932> <WH8802> me.

For since <WH1767> I spake <WH1696> <WH8762>, I cried out <WH2199> <WH8799>, I cried <WH7121> <WH8799> violence <WH2555> and spoil <WH7701>; because the word <WH1697> of the YY <WH3068> was made a reproach <WH2781> unto me, and a derision <WH7047>, daily <WH3117>.

Then I said <WH559> <WH8804>, I will not make mention <WH2142> <WH8799> of him, nor speak <WH1696> <WH8762> any more in his name <WH8034>. But his word was in mine heart <WH3820> as a burning <WH1197> <WH8802> fire <WH784> shut up <WH6113> <WH8803> in my bones <WH6106>, and I was weary <WH3811> <WH8738> with forbearing <WH3557> <WH8771>, and I could <WH3201> <WH8799> not stay.

For I heard <WH8085> <WH8804> the defaming <WH1681> of many <WH7227>, fear <WH4032> on every side <WH5439>. Report <WH5046> <WH8685>, say they, and we will report <WH5046> <WH8686> it. All my familiars <WH582> <WH7965> watched <WH8104> <WH8802> for my halting <WH6763> <WH8676> <WH6761>, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed <WH6601> <WH8792>, and we shall prevail <WH3201> <WH8799> against him, and we shall take <WH3947> <WH8799> our revenge <WH5360> on him.

But the YY <WH3068> is with me as a mighty <WH1368> terrible one <WH6184>: therefore my persecutors <WH7291> <WH8802> shall stumble <WH3782> <WH8735>, and they shall not prevail <WH3201> <WH8799>: they shall be greatly <WH3966> ashamed <WH954> <WH8804>; for they shall not prosper <WH7919> <WH8689>: their everlasting <WH5769> confusion <WH3639> shall never be forgotten <WH7911> <WH8735>.

But, O YY <WH3068> TZva'ot <WH6635>, that triest <WH974> <WH8802> the righteous <WH6662>, and seest <WH7200> <WH8802> the reins <WH3629> and the heart <WH3820>, let me see <WH7200> <WH8799> thy vengeance <WH5360> on them: for unto thee have I opened <WH1540> <WH8765> my cause <WH7379>.

Sing <WH7891> <WH8798> unto the YY <WH3068>, praise <WH1984> <WH8761> ye the YY <WH3068>: for he hath delivered <WH5337> <WH8689> the soul <WH5315> of the poor <WH34> from the hand <WH3027> of evildoers <WH7489> <WH8688>.
Cursed <WH779> <WH8803> be the day <WH3117> wherein I was born <WH3205> <WH8795>: let not the day <WH3117> wherein my mother <WH517> bare <WH3205> <WH8804> me be blessed <WH1288> <WH8803>.

Cursed <WH779> <WH8803> be the man <WH376> who brought tidings <WH1319> <WH8765> to my father <WH1>, saying <WH559> <WH8800>, A man <WH2145> child <WH1121> is born <WH3205> <WH8795> unto thee; making him very <WH8055> <WH8763> glad <WH8055> <WH8765>.

And let that man <WH376> be as the cities <WH5892> which the YY <WH3068> overthrew <WH2015> <WH8804>, and repented <WH5162> <WH8738> not: and let him hear <WH8085> <WH8804> the cry <WH2201> in the morning <WH1242>, and the shouting <WH8643> at noontide <WH6256> <WH6672>;
Because he slew <WH4191> <WH8790> me not from the womb <WH7358>; or that my mother <WH517> might have been my grave <WH6913>, and her womb <WH7358> to be always <WH5769> great <WH2030> with me.

Wherefore came I forth <WH3318> <WH8804> out of the womb <WH7358> to see <WH7200> <WH8800> labour <WH5999> and sorrow <WH3015>, that my days <WH3117> should be consumed <WH3615> <WH8799> with shame <WH1322> ?
